intro: Anamirta cocculus, commonly known as the sacred lotus or Indian bean, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Asia. The plant produces distinctive, fleshy fruits that contain a single, hard-coated seed. Its morphology and growth habits make it an interesting subject in both ecological and botanical studies.
